is a small town located about 10km outside of
populated by Ethnic Albanians and Bosniaks. It has nothing particular of interest except for the fact that if you are traveling from
or vice-versa you'll have to take a bus to this town and make a fairly difficult transfer to some other form of transport.
To get to Tuzi you will need to take a bus from

. To find the buses in Podgorica you will have to ask around, they are about 400 m from Ulica Sloboda. Ask any young person and they should be able to help you. The taxi guys will want to charge you €10 to take you there. You can get there on a combi bus for about €2.
Buses number 41/42 go there from a bus stop in front of main bus station. Ticket is 1 euro.

value: About 10km out of Tuzi and towards Podgorica there is a wonderful stream that has cut a deep (30 m) canyon into the flat plains that

and Tuzi lie on. A clever entrepreneur then dammed a small section of this up to make a swimming resort and built a restaurant. This "resort" is located on the way to Tuzi, if you ask the combi driver he can drop you off at the entrance.

Skadar Lake (Lqeni i shkoders) is just 7 km away. There are picnic places, fishing, and bird shooting places.

In Tuzi is also one of the biggest markets which is open air and have different products from Greece, Turkey, Bulgaria, China, etc. It is open until 2PM.

value: - To get to Albania you'll have to go and wait on the outskirts of the town on the road to the border. The best thing to do will be to find either a combi or pay a person who stops €5/person to take you to Skadar.
